intro: Baeothryon atacamense, commonly known as the Atacama liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, leafy plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant has a thalloid structure with a central axis and leaf-like structures arranged in a spiral pattern. It is native to the arid regions of the Atacama Desert in South America, where it has adapted to survive in extreme conditions. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation to harsh environments.
